{"url":"https://www.sejongacademy.org","name":"Sejong Academy: A Tuition-FREE Korean Immersion Charter School","description":"
Sejong Academy opened in September, 2014 as a Korean immersion charter school with grades K-6, adding a grade every year thereafter until we reach 8th grade. ","image":"//static1.squarespace.com/static/54ae926ce4b084338ad939a8/t/54aeb4c5e4b02f8ed41b1e23/1587676144572/","@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"WebSite"}

img.p: A Tuition-FREE Korean Immersion Charter School

img.alt: Sejong Academy: A Tuition-FREE Korean Immersion Charter School

p.br: Per the Governor's April 23 announcement, schools will continue distance learning through the rest of the 2019-2020 school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sejong Academy’s last day of school will be Thursday, June 4, 2020.

div.p: Note: no school for students on May, 1, 4 and 25.
div.h1: Please click here to go to our DISTANCE LEARNING Page for instructions and information from your teachers. click here for helpful videos.
div.p: If you have not received your computer device, please email info@sejongacademy.org or call the school 651-330-6944. If there is an problem with your computer device, please email your homeroom teacher. Email addresses may be found on the staff page (click here).

During distance learning, we will be delivering LUNCHES to families who requested them on Mondays and Wednesdays between 11-12. If you do not know your bus delivery time, email Ms. Juju. For families who do not ride the bus, you may pick up lunches at Sejong on Mondays and Wednesdays between 11 a.m. - 1 p.m.

p.br: Download our 2019-20 Academic Calendar for important information such as school closing days, testing days and other dates.

Refer here for our testing calendar. However, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Minnesota Department of Education has applied for a waiver. So, it is very likely that MCA’s will be cancelled for 2020.

Sejong Academy has been approved to serve free breakfast and lunch to all students under the Community Eligibility Provision with the Minnesota Department of Education. Please e-mail Mr. Si to let him know if your child plans to eat breakfast and lunch.
The school is located in the Hamline-Midway neighborhood of St. Paul at 1330 Blair Avenue N., St. Paul, MN 55104.
